card.name: Beast
card.property: Multitasker — Response: After you draw an event or resource, put that card into your reserve → draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.) “Oh, my stars and garters! What have we here?”

alternate.name: Hank McCoy
alternate.property: R&D — You may include up to 6 upgrades from aspects other than your chosen aspect. Your minimum deck size is 45 cards. Action: Put a card from your hand into your reserve. (Limit once per round.) “Flavour text.”

card.name: Beast
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust this card → heal 1 damage from your identity and 1 damage from Beast. “I'll set-up the device while you--”“--Run those calculations. Lets--” —Beast (Earth 616)“--Tag team a scientific solution.”

card.name: Addition by Subtraction
card.property: Hero Action (attack): Deal 3 damage to an enemy. If this attack defeats an enemy, repeat this attack. “The noblest answer unto such, is kindly silence when they brawl.” —Alfred Lord Tennyson

card.name: Lateral Thinking
card.property: Hero Action (thwart): Remove 3 threat from a scheme. If you played this card from your hand, put this card into your reserve. “Perhaps a new perspective will present a possible resolution for this perplexing problem.” —Beast

card.name: Logical Solution
card.property: Action: Choose an attachment with the text “Alter-Ego Action” or “Hero Action”. Discard that attachment. “Oftentimes, concocting a feasible countermeasure to the opponent's paraphernalia is a trying and complex process. However, in this instance brute force will suffice.” —Beast

card.name: Spring into Action
card.property: Hero Action: Ready your hero. “We few, we happy few, we band of brothers; For he who sheds his blood with me this day shall be my brother; be he ne'er so vile, this day shall gentle his condition; And men in England now abed, will count their manhoods cheap, they were not here with us to fight on Crispin's day!” —William Shakespeare, Henry V

card.name: Beast's Lab
card.property: Alter-Ego Action: Exhaust Beast's Lab → choose a player. That player searches their deck and discard pile for an upgrade and plays it (paying its resource cost). “This is absolutely fascinating on every conceivable level.” —Beast

card.name: Keen Mind
card.property: Increase your reserve limit by 1. Resource: Exhaust Keen Mind → generate a [mental] resource (generate a [wild] resource instead if paying for a card in your reserve). ”As Archimedes said when he discovered the principle of displacement; Eureka!” —Beast

card.name: Prehensile Feet
card.property: You can control 1 additional upgrade that has the restricted keyword. Action: Exhaust Prehensile Feet → put a card from your reserve into your hand. “My prodigious pedal extremities have things in hand... or foot, to be more accurate.” —Beast

card.name: Scientific Solution
card.property: Response: After you draw an event or resource, put that card into your reserve → draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.) “To answer the age-old question of whether one would rather serve in righteous heaven or rule in pragmatic hell, I'm forced to say, Dr. McCoy, you might just be the devil.” —Beast

card.name: Secondary Mutations
card.property: You get +4 hit points. Hank McCoy gets +1 REC. Beast gets +1 ATK, and +1 DEF. “According to your records you genetically tampered with our own mutation years ago...” —Beast (Earth-TRN240)

card.name: Mutation Degeneration
card.property: You may flip to alter-ego form. Choose: Exhaust any 2 of your alter-ego, your hero-specific ally, or Beast's Lab → remove Mutation Degeneration from the game. Exhaust your identity and take 2 damage. Discard this obligation.

card.name: Dark Beast
card.property: Quickstrike. Forced Response: After Dark Beast attacks and damages a character, place 2 threat on the Dark Experimentation side scheme. If the Dark Experimentation side scheme is not in play, heal 2 damage from Dark Beast and the villain instead.

card.name: Dark Experimentation
card.property: Dark Beast is using chemistry and robotics to concoct vile and dangerous experiments. Enters play with 1 test counter. Forced Response: After resolving step 1 of the villain phase, if there are no test counters here, place 1 test counter here. Otherwise, seek an attachment from the encounter deck and reveal it. Then, remove 1 test counter from here and shuffle each other card discarded this way into the encounter deck.

card.name: Cybernetic Enhancements
card.property: Attach to a unique ([unique]) minion. If you cannot, search the encounter deck and discard pile for Dark Beast. Put him into play engaged with you with this card attached to him. Forced Response: After this card is attached to a minion, give attached minion a tough status card. Attached minion gets +2 hit points.

card.name: Horrifying Test Subject
card.property: Attach to a non-unique minion. If you cannot, this card gains surge. Attached minion gains armored 1 and the [[cyborg]] trait. Forced Interrupt: When attached enemy would be defated, if no excess damage was dealt to it heal damage from this minion until it has 1 hit point remaining.

card.name: Power Dampening Serum
card.property: Attach to your identity. Treat the text boxes of your hero and any [[superpower]] upgrades you control as if they were blank (except for [[traits]]). You cannnot play [[superpower ]]cards. Alter-Ego Action: Spend a [mental] resource and exhaust your identity → discard this card.
